```{r Inputting data & making sure everything is organized correctly}
pam_all_ammonium.data <- read.csv("PAM_ammonium_only_3_5_23.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",",stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

#getting rid of all the extra data at the bottom-- we only want rows 1:959 OR 1:639 if only looking at exp 2 and 3 (remember we got rid of the outlier!)
#pam_all_ammonium.data  <- pam_all_ammonium.data[(1:482),]
pam_all_ammonium.data <- na.omit(pam_all_ammonium.data)


#changing some column names
pam_all_ammonium.data<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, select = -c(temp))
#renaming columns in base R because dplyr is freaking out
colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data)[colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data) == "sym_state"] ="sym_state_full"
colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data)[colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data) == "sym_state.1"] ="sym_state"
colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data)[colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data) == "temp.1"] ="temp"

#Setting everything I need as factors for linear model and stats
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species)
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_dose<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_dose)
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose)
pam_all_ammonium.data$temp<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$temp)
pam_all_ammonium.data$food<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$food)
pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state<-as.character(pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state)
pam_all_ammonium.data$food_sym_state<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$food_sym_state)
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dosee <- factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose, levels=c("CNTRL_0", "A_5", "A_7.5","A_10"))
pam_all_ammonium.data$control_or_nutrient<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$control_or_nutrient)
summary(pam_all_ammonium.data$temp)

#lets check for normality in PAM_delta
hist(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_delta)
qqnorm(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_delta, main = NULL)
# it looks pretty normal

hist(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_avg_day1) # eh
qqnorm(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_avg_day1, main = NULL)

hist(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_avg_day11) # eh
qqnorm(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_avg_day11, main = NULL)

```


```{r Basic list of subsets}
# all aposymbiotic
all_apo<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state=="A")
# all symbiotic
all_sym<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state=="S")
# all fed
all_fed<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$food=="F")
# all starved
all_starved<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$food=="S")
# all 20C
all_20<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$temp=="20")
# all 30C
all_30<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$temp=="30")

#without controls
no_controls <- subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$N_dose!=0)
```

```{r PAM delta Model selection }
#were not going to look at genetic ID so let's do an lm

#stepAIC is from the MASS package
fullModel = lm(PAM_delta ~   N_species_dose + temp + sym_state  + N_species_dose*temp + N_species_dose*sym_state + temp*sym_state, data= pam_all_ammonium.data) # model with all 9 variables and possible combinations

nullModel = lm(PAM_delta ~  1, data= pam_all_ammonium.data) # model with the intercept only

summary(stepAIC(nullModel, # start with a model containing no variables
                direction = 'forward', # run forward selection
                scope = list(upper = fullModel, # the maximum to consider is a model with all variables
                             lower = nullModel), # the minimum to consider is a model with no variables
                trace = 1)) # do not show the step-by-step process of model selection

summary(fullModel)
#model it selected for:
lm_pam_1 <- lm(formula = PAM_delta ~ sym_state + temp + temp*sym_state, data = pam_all_ammonium.data)
summary(lm_pam_1)

#lets check out some other models
lm_pam_2 <- lm(formula = PAM_delta ~ sym_state + temp + N_species_dose, data = pam_all_ammonium.data)
summary(lm_pam_2)

AIC(lm_pam_1, lm_pam_2)

#linear model 1 is clearly the winner here

#no overall effect of dose

plot_model(lm_pam_1, type="diag") #data fitness looks decent
r2(lm_pam_1)

```

```{r SYM linear model}
#stepAIC is from the MASS package
fullModel = lm(PAM_delta ~   N_species_dose + temp  + N_species_dose*temp, data= all_sym) # model with all 9 variables and possible combinations

nullModel = lm(PAM_delta ~  1, data= all_sym) # model with the intercept only

summary(stepAIC(nullModel, # start with a model containing no variables
                direction = 'forward', # run forward selection
                scope = list(upper = fullModel, # the maximum to consider is a model with all variables
                             lower = nullModel), # the minimum to consider is a model with no variables
                trace = 1)) # do not show the step-by-step process of model selection

summary(fullModel)
# it only selected for:
lm_sym_1 <- lm(PAM_delta ~  temp, data= all_sym)

#lets see if we add the N_species_dose * temp what happens
lm_sym_2 <- lm(PAM_delta ~  N_species_dose + temp, data= all_sym)
summary(lm_sym_2)
#WINNER


AIC(lm_sym_1, lm_sym_2)

emm_sym_pam_N_species_dose_temp=emmeans(lm_sym_2, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose*temp)
summary(emm_sym_pam_N_species_dose_temp)

#really no effect of dose

#graph sym only by N species dose and temperature

# Summarize by temp and N species dose so we can visualize
sum_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium <- summarySE(all_sym, measurevar = "PAM_delta", groupvars = c("temp","N_species_dose"))
sum_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium$N_species_dose <- factor(sum_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium$N_species_dose, levels=c("CNTRL_0", "A_5", "A_7.5","A_10"))
# Visualize
gg_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium<-ggplot(data = sum_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium,
       aes(x = N_species_dose,
           y = PAM_delta, col=temp)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=PAM_delta-se, ymax=PAM_delta+se), width=0.1, size = 1) +
    #scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "darkgreen")) +
    ggtitle ("SYM CORALS ammonium PAM - Change in Fv/Fm") +
    labs(x = "ammonium dose", 
         y = expression(paste("Change in Fv/Fm")), 
         caption = "data represent mean +/- SEM" ) +
    scale_x_discrete("ammonium dose", labels=c(CNTRL_0="Control", N_1.5="1.5uM", N_5="5uM", N_18="18uM"))+
    scale_color_manual("Temperature",labels=c("20C","30C"), values=c("blue", "red"))
gg_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium


# generating ptemp and pdose:
summary(aov_temp<-aov(PAM_delta ~ temp, data=all_sym))
Anova(aov_temp, type="III")
summary(emmeans(aov_temp, specs=pairwise ~ temp))

#ptemp=<0.0001

summary(aov_temp<-aov(PAM_delta ~ N_species_dose, data=all_sym))
Anova(aov_temp, type="III")
summary(emmeans(aov_temp, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose))

#pdose=0.36
  
#food for funsies
summary(aov_food<-aov(PAM_delta ~ food, data=all_sym))
Anova(aov_food, type="III")

#pfood=0.79

#food doesnt seem to matter at all
  
```

```{r Symbiotic State - PAM_delta}
# AMMONIUM ONLY

# plot, treatment x axis colored by site data figure

  geom_errorbar(aes(x = sym_state, ymax = PAM_delta+se, ymin = PAM_delta-se), width = .2, position = position_dodge(width=0.3)) +

                    #labels = c("Control 30C Fed","Control 30C Starved","Ammonium High 30C Fed", "Ammonium High 30C Starved","test"),
```

```{r PAM delta Temperature graphs}
    scale_color_manual("Temperature",labels=c("20C","30C"), values=c("blue", "red"))
gg_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium_sym
```

```{r Controls vs. Nutrient - CHALK TALK}
# STATS STATS STATS
mm_PAM_delta_control_v_nutrient <- lmer(PAM_delta ~  temp + control_or_nutrient + (1 | col_num), data=pam_all_ammonium.data)
summary(mm_PAM_delta_control_v_nutrient)

# Summarize by control_or_nutrient * e_coli
emm_control_v_nutrient=emmeans(mm_PAM_delta_control_v_nutrient, specs=pairwise ~ control_or_nutrient*e_coli_plate)
summary(emm_control_v_nutrient)

# Summarize by control_or_nutrient * temp
emm_control_v_nutrient=emmeans(mm_PAM_delta_control_v_nutrient, specs=pairwise ~ control_or_nutrient*temp)
summary(emm_control_v_nutrient)

# Summarize by control_or_nutrient * symbiotic state
emm_control_v_nutrient=emmeans(mm_PAM_delta_control_v_nutrient, specs=pairwise ~ control_or_nutrient*sym_state)
summary(emm_control_v_nutrient)
```
